about.name: Sam Forbush
about.title: Student at Boston College
about.bio: Sam Forbush is a student at Boston College. He is a CS major and Math minor, with a primary interest in software development. He graduated from Algonquin Regional High School in 2019 and will graduate from BC in 2023.

projects.title: Rod Cell Simulation
projects.description: This project, completed in 2019, simulates the distribution of rod cells in the human eye, taking into account the expected proportion of colored rods. It was developed in Ocaml as a part of the Computer Science 1 Honors program at Boston College. As shown, the cells are not completely randomly distributed, as there is approximately even space between any two neighboring cells. This was done to make a more realistic simulation, as the cells in the human eye are also approximately evenly spaced.

projects.title: Poetry Generation and Evaluation in Python
projects.description: With partner Dyson Ye, the goal of this project was to generate convincing poetic language from limited data and with little to no supervision. The methods for generation include a charactere level LSTM model and the Hafez model. Along the way, we tested the ability of existing computational evaluators on generated poetry.
